definition: to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The number of reputable hero, an instant fall.
sentences.chinese: 有多少英雄名噪一时，瞬间陨落。

sentences.english: Another Western shibboleth about the future will thereby fall.
sentences.chinese: 另一个西方对未来的过气观点也会因此陨落。

sentences.english: Can states fail within the developed world?
sentences.chinese: 发达国家中也会有国家走向陨落吗？

sentences.english: Concluded, dropt in the night, and was gone.
sentences.chinese: 完结，在黑夜中陨落，并永远消失了。

sentences.english: The national sports is a star in sports domain forever in China.
sentences.chinese: 民族体育是体育领域中永不陨落的星。

sentences.english: Pride goeth before destruction: and the spirit is lifted up before a fall.
sentences.chinese: 骄横是灭亡的先声，傲慢是陨落的前导。

sentences.english: 12 in the fall of each star of the evening, again and again for my loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 在每个星光陨落的晚上，一遍一遍数我的寂寞。

sentences.english: During Chunqiu period, Fatality Order declined and Zhou Rite was faced with legitimacy crises.
sentences.chinese: 春秋以降，天命陨落，周礼出现严重的合法性危机。

definition: to fall/meteor/to perish/see also 殞|殒[yun3]
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
